definition: in unbroken succession (idiom)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
(negative prefix)/not/no
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: It was not long before he began to quarrel with his wife and later family conflicts were a usual practice.
sentences.chinese: 没过多久他就和妻子争吵起来，家庭冲突接连不断。

sentences.english: A rash of self-mutilations by prison inmates is disturbing.
sentences.chinese: 监狱囚犯的自毁行为接连不断，令人担忧。

sentences.english: In the US they appear to be succeeding.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，这些看起来在接连不断的发生。

sentences.english: If the weather keeps raining, the sports meet will have to be postponed again.
sentences.chinese: 如果气象接连不断地下雨，运动会只能再脱期了。

sentences.english: Herdsmen come to see Gongjue living Buddha incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 牧民们还是接连不断地来找贡觉活佛。

sentences.english: The long succession of wet days wore us out.
sentences.chinese: 长时间接连不断的阴雨天使我们很厌烦。

definition: one after another (idiom)/in quick succession
continuous/unceasing
one by one/one after another
to come one after the other
a succession of/a series of
one after the other/a succession of/a series of
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
on end/in a row/in succession
repeatedly
countless/innumerable

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to spring up everywhere/from all around
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
